subject: Re: [junit] JUnit with Selenium-RC how to
msgSnippet: ... Thank you Joshua. I still don t quite understand. What is SeleniumTestCase doing? As far as I know it, Selenium Core is JavaScript only. How do you call
messageBody:
Joshua Kerievsky wrote:
> On Mon, Feb 23, 2009 at 11:26 PM, Malte Finsterwalder <
> malte@...> wrote:
>
>> I don't know whether I understand you correctly.
>> Can you show an example of a simple JUnit test that uses Selenium Core?
>
>
> public class SeleniumGeneratedTest extends SeleniumTestCase {
> @Test
> public void signupWithConfirmation() {
> open("/selenium/firstTest/welcome.html");
> clickAndWait("signMeUpLink");
> assertTitle("Sign Me Up");
> assertTextPresent("Get Ready to Travel!");
> click("boardPreferenceLong");
> select("destination", "label=Costa Rica");
> check("includeSurfCampLodgingInfo");
> type("specialInstructions", "Warm water, point breaks, please");
> clickAndWait("showMe");
> }
> }

Thank you Joshua.
I still don't quite understand. What is SeleniumTestCase doing?
As far as I know it, Selenium Core is JavaScript only. How do you call
that from JUnit without RC. Or am i missing something?

Greetings,
Malte
